Introduction

Echinacea (Echinacea purpurea) — Echinacea has been used by Native American tribes for centuries for various purposes, including as a remedy for infections and wounds.

Image: John Doe · CC BY-SA 4.0 · Example Source

Benefits & Uses

Tea

  • May provide a soothing beverage

Culinary

  • Used as a garnish or in salads

Salve

  • Can be used in topical applications for skin

Tincture

  • Extracted for herbal uses

Other

Tea

Ingredients

  • Dried Echinacea leaves and flowers
  • Water

Steps

  1. Boil water
  2. Add Echinacea
  3. Steep for 10 minutes
  4. Strain and serve

Salve

Ingredients

  • Dried Echinacea
  • Beeswax
  • Olive oil

Steps

  1. Infuse olive oil with Echinacea
  2. Melt beeswax and mix with oil
  3. Pour into containers to cool

Culinary

Ideas

  • Use as a decorative garnish on dishes

  • Fresh Echinacea root
  • Alcohol (vodka or brandy)

  2. Cover with alcohol in a jar
  3. Seal and let sit for 4-6 weeks, shaking occasionally

Tea

  • Dried eucalyptus leaves
  • Water

  3. Steep for 5-10 minutes.
  4. Strain and serve.

  • Eucalyptus oil
  • Carrier oil (e.g., coconut oil)
  • Beeswax

  2. Add eucalyptus oil after removing from heat.
  3. Pour into a container and let it solidify.

Culinary

  • Dried eucalyptus leaves
  • Alcohol (e.g., vodka)

  1. Place dried leaves in a jar.
  2. Cover with alcohol and seal.

Introduction

Sagebrush (Artemisia tridentata) — Sagebrush is native to the western United States and has been an important plant for local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. It is often associated with arid landscapes and plays a crucial role in preventing soil erosion.

Image: John Doe · CC BY-SA 4.0 · https://commons.wikimedia.org

Benefits & Uses

Tea

  • Sagebrush tea is made from the leaves and is noted for its aromatic qualities.

Culinary

  • Leaves can be used to flavor meats and stews.

Salve

Tincture

Other

  • Used for ornamental purposes in xeriscaping.

Ways to Prepare

Tea

Ingredients

  • Dried sagebrush leaves
  • Water

Steps

  1. Boil water.
  2. Add dried leaves to boiling water.
  3. Steep for 5-10 minutes.
  4. Strain and serve.

Salve

Ingredients

  • Dried sagebrush leaves
  • Oil
  • Beeswax

Steps

  1. Infuse dried leaves in oil over low heat.
  2. Strain the mixture.
  3. Combine with melted beeswax, stir until cool.

Culinary

Ideas

  • Add fresh or dried leaves to roasted meats, or use in marinades.

Tincture

  • Dried sagebrush leaves
  • Alcohol

Steps

  1. Combine dried leaves with alcohol in a jar.
  2. Seal and let sit for several weeks, shaking occasionally.
  3. Strain before use.
